p: Our findings indicate that climate change will not always lead to the expansion of the geographical distribution of disease vectors such as sand flies. Lutzomyia intermedia and L. neivai will have smaller areas of climatic suitability available to them in the future, but they might disperse into new areas, such as southwards into Brazil and Argentina ( L. neivai) and within northeast Brazil ( L. intermedia). Ecological niche models should be species specific, carefully selected and combined in an ensemble approach.
